abstract: Saturday Profile of Stella Gaitano, Sudanese commentator and prize-winning author who writes in Arabic language; Gaitano, who escaped conflict in North Sudan by moving to newly independent South Sudan and adapting to its many different cultures, says she loves working in Arabic, despite fact language is spurned by South Sudanese as language of North's elite.
lead_paragraph: Stella Gaitano has built a distinguished literary reputation for her writings about conflict and displacement, and she has done so in Arabic, the tongue of the north.

headline.main: Telling South Sudan’s Tales in a Language Not Its Own
headline.print_headline: A Writer Commits to Telling South Sudan’s Tales in a Language Not Its Own

snippet: Stella Gaitano has built a distinguished literary reputation for her writings about conflict and displacement, and she has done so in Arabic, the tongue of the north.
